user_message:
<misra_rule>
The target MISRA C 2023 Rule 8.13 is: A pointer should point to a const-qualified type whenever possible.

</misra_rule>
<instruction>
Other agents will judge whether the code follows the MISRA C 2023 guidelines.
They will investigate the code fragments you give.
Your job is to find code fragments in the code that should be investigated to check whether the code follows the MISRA C rule.
</instruction>
<response format>
Provide your answer with these fields.
- suspicious_frags: The list of suspicious code fragments in the code.
It should contain only the code fragments exists in the code. If you do not find any suspicious code fragments, return an empty list for suspicious_frags
- explanation: The explanation of why other code fragments should NOT be investigated.
It is very important to not miss any suspicious code fragments, so please give a sufficient explanation why other code fragments should not be investigated.
DO NOT give any explanation for the selected suspicious code fragments.
</response format>
<target_code>
Here is the code of SHA1Result:
```c
static enum SHA1_RESULT
SHA1Result (struct SHA1Context *context, unsigned char
            Message_Digest[SHA1HashSize])
{
  int i;

  if (! context || ! Message_Digest)
  {
    return SHA1_RESULT_NULL;
  }
  if (context->corrupted)
  {
    return SHA1_RESULT_STATE_ERROR;
  }
  if (! context->computed)
  {
    SHA1PadMessage (context);
    for (i = 0; i < 64; ++i)
    {
      context->message_block[i] = 0;
    }
    context->length_low = 0;
    context->length_high = 0;
    context->computed = 1;
  }
  for (i = 0; i < SHA1HashSize; ++i)
  {
    Message_Digest[i]
      = (unsigned char) (context->intermediate_hash[i >> 2]
                         >> 8 * (3 - (i & 0x03)));
  }
  return SHA1_RESULT_SUCCESS;
}
```
</target_code>
Please find suspicious code fragments in the code and report them. Other agents can not investigate other fragments that you do not report, so it is very important to find all suspicious fragments without missing any. Report the suspicious fragments AS MUCH AS POSSIBLE.
explanation: No code fragments require investigation for MISRA C:2023 Rule 8.13. The function has two pointer parameters: (1) 'struct SHA1Context *context' and (2) 'unsigned char Message_Digest[SHA1HashSize]' (decays to 'unsigned char *'). Both pointers are written to in this function: context is modified (calls SHA1PadMessage(context); zeroes message_block; resets length_low/length_high; sets computed), and Message_Digest[] is assigned to (Message_Digest[i] = ...). Because both pointed-to objects are intentionally modified, they cannot be qualified as pointer-to-const and thus do not violate Rule 8.13. No other pointer targets appear in this fragment that could reasonably be const-qualified.
